alfredsnippet.snippet:
Halton Arp, Seeing Red, p.273

"'You can't vote on the truth.' No matter how many people believe something, if the observations prove it is wrong, it is wrong. But as is often the case with humans it turns out that a lot of scientists actually believe exactly the opposite."
alfredsnippet.name: Phys.org Post - Arp on Consensus Science
